alert.note: Alert for Creek; Osage (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 24 at 9:28AM CDT until May 24 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, Creek, Osage, Pawnee and Tulsa. * WHEN...Until 315 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 925 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is likely ongoing in the warned area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Heaviest amounts have fallen across northwestern Creek, eastern Pawnee and southern Osage counties. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area through early this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tulsa... Sand Springs... Jenks... Skiatook... Hominy... Cleveland... Mannford... Drumright... Oilton... Jennings... Westport... Osage... Hallett... Blackburn... Terlton... Shamrock... Maramec... Walnut Creek State Park... Keystone State Park... Silver City... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
